thread.title: Officials: At least 1 person dead after plane crashes in suburban Bartlett, Ill. - @nbcchicago

author: Stephanie Clary
title: Officials: At least 1 person dead after plane crashes in suburban Bartlett, Ill. - @nbcchicago
text:
At Least 1 Dead in Bartlett Plane Crash Link Close Embed this video <script type="text/javascript" charset="UTF-8" src="http://www.nbcchicago.com/portableplayer/?cmsID=311608791&videoID=FMQMK9n49aT6&origin=nbcchicago.com&sec=news&subsec=local&width=600&height=360"></script> More videos (1 of 9) « » At least one person was killed when a small aircraft crashed in a forest preserve just north of a neighborhood subdivision in Bartlett, NBC Chicago's Natalie Martinez reports. (Published Friday, Jul 3, 2015) Updated at 6:39 PM CDT on Friday, Jul 3, 2015 A least one person was killed when a small aircraft crashed in Bartlett, Illinois Friday afternoon, officials said. The four-seat Cessna 172 was reported to be discovered down in a possible forest preserve area of the west suburban city, according to FAA officials. At Least 1 Killed in Barlett Plane Crash The small aircraft crashed in a forest preserve area just north of a neighborhood subdivision in the west suburban city, according to FAA officials. (Published Friday, Jul 3, 2015) The area was reported to be just north of a neighborhood subdivision on Struckman Boulevard. First responders were on the scene just after 4 p.m. FAA is investigating the cause and details of the crash. This story is developing, check back for details. Published at 4:23 PM CDT on Jul 3, 2015
